articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Dan Williams
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 35 people in a tent camp in the Gaza city of Rafah, medics said, drawing condemnation from European leaders on Monday who urged implementation of a World Court ruling to halt Israel's offensive.
articles.title: Israeli attack on Rafah tent camp draws global condemnation

articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw, Moira Warburton
articles.description: The Biden administration told Israel to take every precaution to protect civilians after a military strike in Rafah killed dozens of Palestinians, as it faced calls from some fellow Democrats to halt military shipments to Israel.
articles.title: Biden tells Israel to protect civilians after Rafah strike

articles.author: Lewis Jackson, Renju Jose
articles.description: Thousands of residents were ordered to evacuate from the path of a still-active landslide in Papua New Guinea by the government on Tuesday, after parts of a mountain collapsed, burying an initial estimate of more than 2,000 people.
articles.title: Papua New Guinea orders thousands to evacuate from path of 'active' landslide

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Ann Wang
articles.description: Taiwan President Lai Ching-te thanked fighter pilots who had scrambled against China last week during its war games around the island, as he was briefed on the events at a frontline air base on Tuesday.
articles.title: Taiwan president thanks pilots who scrambled against China drills

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak on Monday proposed tax cuts for millions of pensioners in his latest campaign pledge, highlighting the importance of older voters in the upcoming July election.
articles.title: UK's Sunak proposes tax cuts for pensioners in new election pledge

articles.author: Francois Murphy
articles.description: Iran is enriching uranium to close to weapons-grade at a steady pace while discussions aimed at improving its cooperation with the U.N. nuclear watchdog are stalled, two confidential reports by the watchdog showed on Monday.
articles.title: Iran's near-bomb-grade uranium stock grows, talks stall, IAEA reports say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Papua New Guinea Prime Minister James Marape is likely to face a no-confidence motion with parliament resuming on Tuesday, after the opposition party nominated Rainbo Paita, who defected from Marape's cabinet days earlier, as alternate prime minister.
articles.title: No-confidence vote looms for Papua New Guinea leader Marape

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Assertions that all arrivals in China will face mobile telephone checks from July 1 are false, authorities said on Tuesday, dismissing them as distortions of the truth made by "anti-China forces".
articles.title: China dismisses as 'preposterous' claims of entry checks for phones

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China and the United States held consultations on maritime affairs in which both countries agreed to maintain dialogue and manage risks, the Chinese Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.
articles.title: China, US agree to manage maritime risks through continued dialogue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spain, Ireland and Norway will officially recognise a Palestinian state on Tuesday, despite an angry reaction from Israel, which has found itself increasingly isolated after seven months of conflict in Gaza.
articles.title: Spain, Ireland, Norway set to recognise Palestinian statehood
